name: Ractive-event-viewport
tagline: Event will be fired when Element has come visible from invisible state or vice versa.
body:
### Ractive-event-viewport Event that is fired as soon as an element appears in the userâ€™s viewport.It uses getBoundingClientRect() method. Requires: RactiveJS ### Usage The script adds `viewport` event to RactiveJS. The event will only fire when the element comes in to view of the viewport, and out of viewport. It won't keep triggering element remains in view or not in view.

ractiveObj.on('someFunc', function(event){ event.original.current // Current state event.original.previous // Previous state event.original.visible // same as event.original.current }); ### How it works An interval in the background checks for the position of the bounding rectangle of element against the viewport dimensions and the parent's scroll position. If it detects any change in view state, it triggers an event on element. ### Browser Compatibility Browsers that support getBoundingClientRect().
